'RAVE' plot container class

Source: R/class-RAVEPlotData.R
RAVEPlotContainer.Rd

Container to generate 'RAVE' built-in figures

Value

The data value if key is found, or a missing value when key is missing

The derivative value if key is found, or a missing value when the key is missing. The derivative will be "processed". When the derivative is a function, then the function will be called with all the data (see set_data) passed as named arguments (see 'Examples'). When use_glue is true, then the derivative will be passed into glue for lazy assessment (see 'Examples').

A named list of derivatives

NULL if no errors found, or a matrix of two columns when fail='inspect': the first column is the validation name, and the second column is the error message

Public fields

verbose

whether to verbose information, warnings

Active bindings

validator_names

names of validation expressions

data_names

names of data variables

derivative_names

names of derivative variables

Methods

Method new()

Constructor

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$new()

Method reset()

Reset 'renderers', 'data', 'derivative', settings, or 'validator'

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$reset(
  type = c("renderers", "all", "data", "derivative", "validator")
)

Arguments

type

type of data to reset

Method mset()

Low-level set data or derivative

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$mset(
  ...,
  .list = list(),
  type = c("data", "derivative"),
  validate = TRUE
)

Arguments

..., .list

named key-value pairs to be stored

type

type of data, 'data' or 'derivative'

validate

whether to validate the data; when error occurs, the container state will be restored to previous state

Method set_data()

Store data

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$set_data(key, value, validate = TRUE)

Arguments

key

name of data

value

value of the key to be stored

validate

whether to validate data; default is true; when error occurs, the container state will be restored to previous state

Method get_data()

Get data

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$get_data(key, if_missing)

Arguments

key

key of data

if_missing

return this value when key is missing

Method remove_data()

Remove data

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$remove_data(keys)

Arguments

keys

one or more keys to remove

Method set_derivative()

Store a derivative

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$set_derivative(key, value, use_glue = FALSE, validate = TRUE)

Arguments

key

name of the derivative

value

value of the derivative; can be an arbitrary value; some special treatments will be done to characters and functions. See get_derivative for details.

use_glue

whether to glue the derivative; default is false

validate

whether to validate data; default is true; when error occurs, the container state will be restored to previous state

Method get_derivative()

Get derivative

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$get_derivative(
  key,
  if_missing,
  env = parent.frame(),
  .internal = FALSE
)

Arguments

key

key of the derivative

if_missing

return this value when key is missing

env

environment to evaluate derivatives

.internal

internally used

Examples


container <- RAVEPlotContainer$new()
container$set_derivative("xlen", function(x) {
  length(x)
})
container$set_derivative(
  key = "xlab",
  "x ({{ typeof(x) }})",
  use_glue = TRUE
)
container$set_data("x", letters)
container$get_derivative("xlen")
container$get_derivative("xlab")

Method get_all_derivative()

Get all the derivatives in a list

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$get_all_derivative(env = parent.frame(), .internal = FALSE)

Arguments

env

environment to evaluate derivatives

.internal

internally used; please do not change

Method remove_derivative()

Remove derivatives

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$remove_derivative(keys)

Arguments

keys

one or more keys to remove

Method add_validator()

Add functions to validate the container

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$add_validator(name, fun)

Arguments

name

name (ID) of the 'validator'; if name exists, then old validation function will be replaced.

fun

validation function, must take one argument (this container) as the argument

Method remove_validator()

Remove a validation function by name

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$remove_validator(name)

Arguments

name

name of the validation function to remove

Method validate()

Validate data integrity of container

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$validate(fail = c("error", "inspect"))

Arguments

fail

action when validation fails; default is the throw the first 'error'; other choices are 'inspect' (run all the validation and report all the errors in matrix)

Method format()

Format the container

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$format(...)

Arguments

...

ignored

Method add_renderer()

Add render expressions

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$add_renderer(expr, quoted = FALSE, order = 0, label = NULL)

Arguments

expr

R expression; all the data and derivatives will be available as variables; please make sure all the global variables in expr come from data or derivatives, or the rendering results might error out. See bquote on how to partial evaluate variables ( and set quoted to true if expr is (partially) quoted).

quoted

whether expr is quoted; default is false

order

render order; smaller values will be rendered first; default value is 0. See order_range in $render method for selective render

label

label of the render expression, can be missing, mainly for verbose and debug use.

Method render()

Render the container

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$render(
  ...,
  .list = list(),
  order_range = c(-1, 100),
  env = parent.frame(),
  validate = TRUE,
  strict = FALSE
)

Arguments

..., .list

additional parameters to use for evaluating rendering expressions; can be used to mask out derivatives or add flags ( data will not be masked out)

order_range

range of render expressions to evaluate; rendering order outside of this range will not be evaluated

env

environment to rendering the container; default is the caller environment

validate

whether to validate the container first before rendering

strict

whether to be strict: if true, then stops when any render function error out; or keep rendering regardless of errors

Method plot()

Render the container, see $render method

Usage

RAVEPlotContainer$plot(..., env = parent.frame())

Arguments

..., env

passed to $render method

Examples


library(ravedash)

# Low-level usage
container <- RAVEPlotContainer$new()

# set data
container$set_data("x", 1:10)
container$set_data("y", 1:20)
container$set_data("data", matrix(1:200, nrow = 10))

# derivative data can be dynamically calculated
container$set_derivative("zlim", function(data) {
  max(abs(range(data, na.rm = TRUE))) * c(-1,1)
})
container$set_derivative("title", "x: {{ length(x) }}, y: {{ length(y) }}",
                       use_glue = TRUE)

# optional, reset renderer state
container$reset("renderers")

container$add_renderer({
  image(data, x = x, y = y, zlim = zlim, main = title)
})

container$add_renderer({
  image(t(data), x = y, y = x, zlim = zlim, main = title)

  # renderer will go through with a warning
  stop(123)
})

container$add_renderer({
  plot(x)
}, order = 3)

# Pre-pend renderers
container$add_renderer({
  par(mfrow = c(1, 3))
}, order = -1)

# reset status
container$add_renderer({
  logger("Reset graphical status")
  par(mfrow = c(1,1))
}, order = 100)


# Render all
plot(container)
#> {
#>     image(t(data), x = y, y = x, zlim = zlim, main = title)
#>     stop(123)
#> }


# Partial render
plot(container, order_range = 3)





## ------------------------------------------------
## Method `RAVEPlotContainer$get_derivative`
## ------------------------------------------------


container <- RAVEPlotContainer$new()
container$set_derivative("xlen", function(x) {
  length(x)
})
container$set_derivative(
  key = "xlab",
  "x ({{ typeof(x) }})",
  use_glue = TRUE
)
container$set_data("x", letters)
container$get_derivative("xlen")
#> [1] 26
container$get_derivative("xlab")
#> x (character)
